<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 230, 292]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
9709/22  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 310, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
May/June 2025  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 325, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 371]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 393, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 270, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 485, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 359, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 868, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 480, 575]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 606]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 860, 637]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 212, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 384, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 50.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 730, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 79, 94, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 75, 631, 103]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\int_{2}^{11} \frac{8}{4x + 1} \mathrm{~d}x = \ln a\), where \(a\) is an integer to be found.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 78, 920, 100]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 710, 92]]<|/det|>
Sketch on the same diagram the graphs of \(y = \left|2x - 9\right|\) and \(y = 4x - 5\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 79, 92, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 831, 101]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of the stationary points of the curve with equation \(y = \frac{8x}{2x + 3} - 6x + 5\). [5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 78, 920, 98]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 92, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 87, 609, 265]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 279, 920, 314]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows parts of the curves with equations \(y = 4\mathrm{e}^{- 2x}\) and \(y = 1 + 0.5\sin 3x\). Point \(P\) is a point of intersection of the curves, and the shaded region is bounded by the two curves and the \(y\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 327, 144, 345]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 327, 828, 346]]<|/det|>
Show that the \(x\)-coordinate of \(P\) satisfies the equation \(x = -0.5\ln (0.25 + 0.125\sin 3x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 327, 917, 345]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 543, 143, 562]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 543, 920, 593]]<|/det|>
Use an iterative formula, based on the equation in part (a), to find the \(x\)-coordinate of \(P\) correct to 4 significant figures. Use an initial value of 0.5 and give the result of each iteration to 6 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 574, 920, 593]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 390, 91]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is defined by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[359, 101, 640, 123]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{p}(x) = ax^{4} + bx^{3} + 13x^{2} - 35x + 15,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 134, 771, 153]]<|/det|>
where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants. It is given that \((2x - 1)\) and \((x - 3)\) are factors of \(\mathrm{p}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 166, 146, 184]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 166, 366, 184]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 166, 920, 184]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 326, 88]]<|/det|>
Hence factorise \(\mathrm{p}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 72, 920, 89]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 504, 181, 521]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 504, 685, 521]]<|/det|>
Find the least positive value of \(\theta\) in radians such that \(\mathrm{p}(\cot 2\theta) = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 504, 920, 521]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 97, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Express \(4\cos \theta \sin (\theta +30^{\circ})\) in the form \(R\cos \left(2\theta -\alpha\right) + k\), where \(R > 0\), \(0^{\circ} < \alpha < 90^{\circ}\) and \(k\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 85, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 102, 920, 135]]<|/det|>
If you use the following page to complete the answer to any question, the question number must be clearly shown.
